title: For Sale:  S&W 38 Special Military & Police - Early 1900's Mfg.
postcontent:
This is the model of 1905, 3rd change from the research I have done, and was manufactured between 1909 and 1915. It has been altered from original, the barrel has been cut to about 3 inches, and it has been nickel plated. The grips are not original, and are finger groove rubber. The gun is in overall nice shape, action is smooth on double or single action, lockup is tight, and there doesn't appear to be any function problems or issues. It is not recommended to shoot Plus P ammo in this series, only after 4th change is it recommended. I bought it from an FFL dealer some time ago, and have never made use of it, and have decided to offer it for sale.

Sorry, photos are not very good, we can meet in the local area for a no-obligation look at it.

Cash only, local area face to face with a bill of sale to an Alabama resident only.

title: For Sale:  Kel-Tec PMR 30, New, Gray
postcontent: Up for sale is the very hard to find and fun to shoot PMR 30, this one in gray. The PMR-30 is a lightweight, full size pistol (.22WMR). The PMR-30 operates on a unique hybrid blow back/locked-breech system, allowing for the use of a wide variety of ammunition as it seamlessly adjusts depending on the pressure of the cartridge. It uses a flush fit, 30-round double stack Zytel nylon magazine with round count ports. The trigger is a crisp single action with an over travel stop. It has a thumb-activated ambidextrous safety lever. The slide locks back after the last shot and a manual slide lock lever is also provided. The slide and barrel are 4140 steel, the frame is 7075 aluminum. The grip, slide cover, trigger, mag release, and safety levers are glass reinforced nylon (Zytel). Other features include: dual opposing extractors for reliability, heel magazine release to aid in magazine retention, dovetailed aluminum front sight, Picatinny accessory rail under the barrel, urethane recoil buffer, and captive coaxial recoil springs. It has a fluted barrel for light weight and effective heat dissipation. PMR30 disassembles for cleaning by removal of a single pin. We buy guns and layaway is available! Sorry, no trades and all state and local laws apply. We are an FFL dealer so you must be able to pass a background check. 3% credit card fee. We can also ship this gun to other FFLs if needed.

The Smith and Wesson Model 39 was the first U.S. designed double action (DA) semi-automatic pistol marketed in the United States. In 1949, Smith and Wesson began development of the Model 39 DA semi-auto in caliber 9x19mm Luger. Smith and Wesson began selling the Model 39 commercially in 1955. title: For Sale:  ATTENTION 1911 GUYS......
postcontent: I have an Ithaca 1911. This weapon was made during WW2, and was carried by the man I got it from. This man lived in Berryville,  Arkansas. ....home of Wilson Combat.  This man took his service pistol to Wilson and had work done to it. This was actually one of the first 1911 pistols that Wilson worked on, when Wilson was just doing overhauls on existing 1911's.  Wilson refinished it, put a new bushing in the front, put Wilson sights, Wilson trigger job and ground down the hammer so it is flat, and a larger thumb safety.  Everything else is original and matching and stamped. It is actually stamped Wilson Combat under the serial number. This is a piece of history that has been worked over by arguably the best 1911 gunsmiths in the country. This weapon does shoot but likes full load ball ammo, which it was designed to fire. REDACTED. I would be willing to trade for good quality .223/556 or 9mm.

Positive feedback will be given to all buyers who pay promptly only after positive feedback has been received.  We try our best to present you with a positive buying experience.  Please email us with any suggestions for improvement.  Please do not leave negative feedback without contacting us via phone or email to discuss the problem at hand.  Most cases can be mediated.
Returns:
Factory new items are sold as is.  The warranty is to be handled through the original manufacturer.  We will accept returns with prior notice only.  Notice is to be made within a 3 day inspection period from which the merchandise was received. We will issue a 100% refund if we made a mistake in our listing. There will be a 25% restocking fee on all returned items.  Merchandise must still be sealed and as new.  All used merchandise must be in the same shape it left our store in.  Condition will be evaluated when it is received back.  There are no refunds on listings stated "AS IS" in the description. We will not refund any shipping cost or auction fees. All parts should be fitted by qualified personnel. Please email or call if you have any questions before purchasing. 
Other:
Our contact information is available at our website. You can also ask a question via Ebay, Gunbroker, or the website in which you found our listing on. The winning bidder needs to have paid or made contact with us within 3 business days after the auction ending. We are open to trades and offers.
As these items are for sale in multiple venues, we reserve the right to cancel the sale at any time.  On rare occasion we may sell out of an item before we are able to remove it from out listing.  In such an instance we will do our best to either provide the buyer with an equivalent product, discount another product, cancel the sale, or issue a full refund if payment has already been made.  We do our best to avoid these situations, but we are all human and it happens.  Thank you for understanding.

title: For Sale:  EXTREMELY RARE Winchester Arcade Rifle
location: Columbia Upper Richland County, Columbia, South Carolina
postcontent:
There were approximately 60 or so of these guns ever made and only about 6 are not held by Winchester. They have sold for as mush as $5,000.00. The last one that went on the market over 10 years ago- sold by me on behalf on Winchester - sold for $2500.00 on this site.

From Wikipedia:
Wingo was an experimental indoor shooting sport invented by Winchester in the early 1970s. The only Wingo facility built was in San Diego, California.
The equipment consisted of a bank of machines that created four-inch diameter hollow spheres of ice. The player had a custom-made .20 calibre shotgun that was about the same size and weight as a .22 calibre rifle. The choice of calibre was to prevent players from bringing their own .22 calibre shells from outside. The gun was tethered to the shooting bench to prevent it from being pointed toward spectators and to facilitate the wiring for the internal microphone that detected when the gun was fired. Only about 20 of these guns were made and they are now very rare collector's items.
In the game, four-inch diameter hollow spheres of ice were fired toward the shooter from one of five ports from a distance of 75 feet. When the player fired the gun a number from 1 to 10 was presented by the scoring machine. The number depended on how quickly the player fired, higher numbers for quicker reactions. If the player hit the sphere he/she scored the number presented by the scoring machine.
Winchester conducted the trial in San Diego, rather than a midwest city where shooting sports were more popular, because they wanted to see if it would catch on in a city where there was an abundance of pastimes. The sport was not financially successful and the Wingo facility was closed in less than a year. The facility is now a branch of the San Diego Superior Court.

There is also a factory letter from Winchester authenticating this rifle.

100% authentic and rare as hell! Call or text me at REDACTED if interested.

title: For Sale:  HK USP .45 Fullsize
postcontent:
Please read the entire listing before emailing me.  I'm motivated to sell.  I've owned this weapon since it was new and put every round through it.  I am going back to school and need the money.  It is an excellent gun and lives up to its reputation.  It handles extremely well for a full size handgun and has the lowest felt recoil of any .45 on the market (including its successors that cost twice as much).

The gun is AG date code meaning it was made after the latest revisions to firing block.  Honestly, I love the gun but am transitioning to the USP compact .45.   

Installed Meprolight Nightsights In early 2014. Very bright.

Variant 1.  I measured the DA/SA at 12 and 4.5 lbs respectively.  The gun is very accurate and training with the long but consistent DA pull will make you a better shooter.  Training with this gun is a whole lot of fun as its big slide and dual recaptured spring take all the punishment.  It's more fun to shoot then snappy 9mm in my opinion because of its recoil characteristics.

Comes with 2 HK USP Magazines with the extended baseplate.  Hold 12 rounds each.  

Gun has some very light holster wear that disappears with oil but the wear happened the second I started using a holster.  

Also have an aftermarket pic-rail adapter (not pictured)

I have holsters and extra magazines (pictured are 4-12rnd Pro Mags, 4 USP .45 12rnd Mags, 1-12rnd Mk.23 mag, stealth Gear IWB and SERPA holsters) as well if you're interested in adding to the asking price.  We can negotiate their prices in email.

Price is firm for the gun and two mags.

title: For Sale:   Kel-Tec SUB-2000 KELTEC SUB-2K40 Beretta 11 RD .40 S&W
postcontent: The SUB-2000 is a self-loading carbine for pistol cartridges. Different versions of the SUB-2000 will accept most modern handgun magazines; see below for a complete list. The SUB-2000 has a greatly enhanced accuracy and extended range compared to a handgun. The superior precision is also very useful against small or partially covered targets at shorter range. The amount of training to master the SUB-2000 is only a fraction of that required for a handgun. The SUB-2000 has been developed from our highly successful SUB-9 rifle. Although retaining some features of the old rifle, the SUB-2000 is a completely new design. Emphasis has been put on consumer safety, but without impeding the performance. Polymers are used to a large extent, resulting in increased durability and reduced price. The bolt can be locked in the rear position by the operating handle. The main safety is of protected push bolt type disconnecting the trigger bar and interlocking the hammer and sear. By rotating the barrel upwards and back, the SUB-2000 can be reduced to a size of 16" x 7" to facilitate secure storage and utilize the internal deployment lock which is operated by a proprietary key. The rear sight is of aperture type and the fluorescent front sight can be adjusted for windage and elevation. The SUB-2000 can easily be disassembled for cleaning or inspection without tools.

title: For Sale:  Glock 27 with extra conversion barrel and more
postcontent:
I have for sale a very lightly used Glock 27.  It's a Gen 3 pistol.  It comes with all of the factory accessories: a hard case, manuals, cleaning rod and brush and magazine loader.  It also comes with a 9 round magazine, and a 9 round magazine with a Pearce grip extension (making it a 10-round magazine).  The grip extension makes the pistol easier to hold for people with larger hands.

In addition to the factory accessories, this pistol also comes with a Lone Wolf brand .40 to 9mm conversion barrel.  Converting this G27 from .40 to 9mm requires nothing more than changing out the barrel and using 9mm magazines.  With this barrel, you have the choice of shooting .40 or 9mm (like the G26) out of this pistol.  To go along with the conversion barrel, I'm including four magazines.  All are Glock brand magazines.  One is 17 round, one is 10 round, and two are 12 round.

Also included is a Blackhawk CQC SERPA holster.  It comes with both the belt loop backing plate and the paddle backing plate.

I'm also throwing in some ammunition.  One box of Federal .40 180 grain FMJ FN (39 rounds left from a 50 round box) and one box of Federal .40 180 grain Hydra-Shok JHP (15 rounds left from a 20 round box).

The only shooting this gun has seen is the 16 rounds of .40 that are missing from these two boxes of ammo, as well as a few hundred rounds of 9mm shot through the conversion barrel.  It has been carried some, but shows no real signs of wear.

Although everything included would cost around $800 new, I am only asking $500.  The reason for the sale is that I have a S&W M&P9c that I prefer for carry, and I'd like to pick up a 1911 in .38 Super.

title: For Sale:  HK 21 style Clubfoot stock and buffer HK 91 PTR 91
postcontent:
For sale are an HK 21 style, US-manufactured clubfoot stock with a heavy rubber butt-pad, and an HK 21 style heavy recoil buffer. These install onto any HK 21 style receiver backplate, or onto HK 91 style receiver endplates with minor fitting to increase the buffer hole diameter. These function in .308 HK rifles, PTR rifles, and may work in other HK clone rifles.

The combination of clubfoot stock and heavy HK buffer reduces the recoil of .308 HK style rifles by an incredible amount, and the shape of the stock makes shooting from prone more ergonomic.

The stock is high-quality US production, in like-new condition. It retails for $150 new (http://www.hkparts.net/shop/pc/HK91-G3-PTR91-Clubfoot-With-Heavy-Rubber-Buttpad-114p1144.htm).

The buffer is either US produced or original HK production. Hk-produced models retail for about $150 new (http://www.hkparts.net/shop/pc/HK21E-HK23E-Factory-Heavy-Buffer-p242.htm).

This is a great value, a $300 stock assembly for only $200!

title: For Sale:  Aimpoint PRO
postcontent:
I've had this optic about 2 months and decided to get a scope for my rifle instead. It comes with a cantilever mount, Aimpoint mount, box and paperwork. Works great. No scratches or anything.  360$ OBO

Aimpoint PRO Patrol Rifle Optic 12841Designed with input from a distinguished group of current and former professionals, the Patrol Rifle Optic incorporates many never before seen features to maximize this sight's performance within the challenging conditions faced by modern law enforcement. A hard-anodized 30mm tube was utilized, enclosing a high efficiency circuit that allows the sight to be turned on and left on for up to three years using a single battery. The Aimpoint PRO Patrol Rifle Optic's front lens utilizes a unique band-pass coating, which allows the sight to be used with all generations of night vision devices. The modular QRP2 mount includes a removable spacer that indexes the sight at the optimal height for co-witness with the standard iron sights on AR15/M16/M4 Carbine style weapons. This spacer can be removed to enable the use of the sight on police shotguns or sub-machine guns. The QRP2 mount for the PRO Optic also incorporates a torque-limiting twist knob that provides the optimal level of pressure on the rail while completely eliminating the possibility of over-tightening. Both the PRO Optic's front and rear lenses are recessed within the sight body to provide protection against impact damage, scratches and fingerprints.
